ur: اللہ کے نام کے ساتھ جو بے انتہا رحم کرنے والا، بِن مانگے دینے والا (اور) بار بار رحم کرنے والا ہے۔

v5.text: [a]In the name of Allah, the Gracious, the Merciful.

notes.note: See 1:1.

ur: کسی پوچھنے والے نے ایک لازماً واقع ہونے والے عذاب کے بارہ میں پوچھا ہے۔

v5.text: An inquirer inquires concerning the punishment about to befall[b] [4367]

notes.note:
Commentary:

"The inquirer" in the verse is taken by some commentators to refer to Nadr bin Al-Harith, or Abu Jahl. But it need not refer to any particular person. The disbelievers had repeatedly challenged the Holy Prophet to bring down upon them the threatened punishment (10:49; 21:39; 27:72; 32:29; 34:30; 36:49; 67:26). The demand was made in doubt and mockery. They had gone so far as to challenge the Prophet with the words, "O Allah, if this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down upon us stones from heaven or bring down upon us a grievous punishment" (8:33). The word "inquirer" may refer to all such questioners.

ur: کافروں سے اُسے کوئی چیز ٹالنے والی نہیں۔

v5.text: The disbelievers, which none can repel.[c]

topics.topic: Attributes of Allah: Dhul-Ma‘arij (Lord of great ascents)

ur: سب بلندیوں کے مالک، اللہ کی طرف سے ہے۔

v5.text: It is from Allah, Lord of great ascents.[4368]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The verse may mean that instead of demanding punishment the disbelievers should have accepted the Message of Islam and thus should have won the pleasure of God. Or it may mean that while the punishment that will overtake disbelievers will be highly destructive, the ascent of the believers to heights of spiritual perfection will also be without end. Or the verse may signify that as the attributes of God are manifested in stages, the punishment of disbelievers will also come in stages. The verse may also signify that the day when disbelievers will receive the most humiliating punishment in the form of the Fall of Mecca will be the most auspicious day in the Holy Prophet’s life—the day of his معراج (Ascension), when he will be at the height of his power.

ar: تَعۡرُجُ  الۡمَلٰٓئِکَۃُ  وَ الرُّوۡحُ  اِلَیۡہِ  فِیۡ یَوۡمٍ کَانَ مِقۡدَارُہٗ  خَمۡسِیۡنَ اَلۡفَ سَنَۃٍ ۚ﴿۵﴾
ur: فرشتے اور روح اس کی طرف ایک ایسے دن میں صعود کرتے ہیں جس کی گنتی پچاس ہزار سال ہے۔

v5.text: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day, the measure of which is fifty thousand years.[4369]

notes.note:
Important Words:

الروح (Spirit) means, the human soul; spirit; the vital principle; inspiration; revelation; Word of God; the Quran; angel Gabriel; joy; happiness; mercy of God, etc. (Lane & Aqrab).

Commentary:

الروح meaning human soul, the word may signify that development and progress of the human soul will know no end. Or the verse may mean that Divine plans and programmes take thousands of years to mature. Or, the words "fifty thousand years" may have reference to the age of the world as estimated by some geologists from a study of the layers of earth. Or the reference may be to a specific cycle of fifty thousand years in which a great change was decreed to take place, because Divine prophecies have their fixed periods, epochs and cycles in which they are fulfilled.

ur: پس صبر جمیل اختیار کر۔

v5.text: [a]So be patient with admirable patience.[4370]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Divine prophecies sometimes take thousands of years for their fulfilment. The Holy Prophetsa is enjoined to bear with patience the mockery and jibes of disbelievers because the hour of their punishment is delayed in order that they may have time to take heed, repent or make amends.

ur: وہ یقیناً اسے بہت دور دیکھ رہے ہیں۔

v5.text: They see it to be far off,

ur: اور ہم اسے قریب دیکھتے ہیں۔

v5.text: [b]But We see it to be nigh.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th
Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of disbelievers on the

ur: جس دن آسمان پگھلے ہوئے تانبے کی طرح ہو جائے گا۔

v5.text: The day when the heaven will become like molten copper,

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: face of disbelievers on the

ur: اور پہاڑ دُھنی ہوئی اون کی طرح ہوجائیں گے۔

v5.text: [c]And the mountains will become like flakes of wool,[4371]

notes.note:
Commentary:

In this age of atom and hydrogen bombs, the flying of mountains like flakes of wool, is not an impossible occurrence.

These verses may also have metaphorical reference to the Fall of Mecca.

ur: اور کوئی گہرا دوست کسی گہرے دوست کا (حال) نہ پوچھے گا۔

v5.text: [d]And a friend will not inquire after a friend.

ar: یُّبَصَّرُوۡنَہُمۡ ؕ یَوَدُّ  الۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ  یَفۡتَدِیۡ مِنۡ عَذَابِ یَوۡمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِیۡہِ ﴿ۙ۱۲﴾
ur: وہ اُنہیں اچھی طرح دکھلا دیئے جائیں گے۔ مجرم یہ چاہے گا کہ کاش وہ اس دن کے عذاب سے بچنے کے لئے فدیہ میں دے سکے اپنے بیٹوں کو۔

v5.text: Though they will be placed in sight of one another, [e]and the guilty one would fain ransom himself from the punishment of that day by offering his children,[4372]

notes.note:
Commentary:

What an awe-inspiring picture of the Day of Judgement is given in these verses! Face to face with a calamity man is prepared to part with everything, even to sacrifice his dearest and nearest ones if only by doing so he can save his own skin.

ur: اور اپنی بیوی کو اور اپنے بھائی کو۔

v5.text: [a]And his wife and his brother,

ur: اور اپنے قبیلہ کو بھی جو اُسے پناہ دیتا تھا۔

v5.text: And his kinsfolk who sheltered him,

ar: وَ مَنۡ  فِی الۡاَرۡضِ جَمِیۡعًا ۙ ثُمَّ  یُنۡجِیۡہِ ﴿ۙ۱۵﴾
ur: اور اُن سب کو جو زمین میں ہیں۔ پھر وہ (فدیہ) اُسے اس (عذاب) سے بچالے۔

v5.text: And by offering all those who are on the earth, if only thus he might save himself.

ur: خبردار! یقیناً وہ ایک بے دھواں زبانِ شعلہ ہے۔

v5.text: But no! surely it is a flame of Fire,

ur: چمڑی کو اُدھیڑ دینے والی۔

v5.text: [b]Stripping off the skin even to the extremities of the body.[4373]

notes.note:
Important Words:

الشویٰ (extremities) is derived from شوی. (shawa). They say شوی اللحم i.e. he roasted meat. شوی means, the arms or hands and the legs or feet, or the fore and hind legs and the extremities collectively; (2) the head of a human being or the bone above the brain. It is also the plural of شواة, which means, the skin of the head in which grow the hair (Lane & Aqrab).

ur: وہ بلاتی ہے ہر اُس شخص کو جس نے پیٹھ پھیرلی اور اِعراض کیا۔

v5.text: It will call him who turned his back and retreated.

ur: اور جمع کیا اور ذخیرہ کیا۔

v5.text: [c]And hoarded wealth, and held it.[4374]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The hoarding of wealth, and not spending it in the service or promotion of good causes is very strongly condemned in these verses.

ur: یقیناً انسان بہت زیادہ حریص پیدا کیا گیا ہے۔

v5.text: Verily, man is born impatient and miserly.[4375]

notes.note:
Important Words:

ھلوعًا (impatient & miserly) is derived from ھلع which means, he was or became agitated, restless, seized with abject discouragement; he became hungry. ھلوع means, one who becomes restless and easily agitated and discouraged when in difficulty; one who is greedy about wealth and miserly in spending it; one who is much grieved and loses patience when in trouble (Aqrab).

Commentary:

The words, "man is born impatient and miserly," mean that man by nature is impatient and miserly. For this meaning of خلقsee 21:38 & 30:55.

ur: جب اُسے کوئی شر پہنچتا ہے تو سخت واویلا کرنے والا ہوتا ہے۔

v5.text: [a]When evil touches him, he is full of lamentations,

ur: اور جب اُسے کوئی بھلائی پہنچتی ہے تو سخت بخیل ہوتا ہے۔

v5.text: But when good falls to his lot, he is niggardly.

ur: ہاں نماز پڑھنے والوں کا معاملہ الگ ہے۔

v5.text: Save those who pray.

ur: وہ لوگ جو اپنی نماز پر دوام اختیار کرنے والے ہیں۔

v5.text: [b]Those who are constant in their Prayer,[4376]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Prayer is the best form of worship; it is an obligation which man owes to God, as the "giving of wealth to the poor" is his obligation to his fellow man. These two together constitute the quintessence of all religious teaching.

ar: وَ الَّذِیۡنَ فِیۡۤ  اَمۡوَالِہِمۡ حَقٌّ مَّعۡلُوۡمٌ ﴿۪ۙ۲۵﴾
ur: اور وہ لوگ جن کے اموال میں ایک معیّن حق ہے۔

v5.text: [c]And those in whose wealth there is a recognized right[4376A]

notes.note:
Commentary:

This verse shows that all things in the universe being the common property of all mankind, there can be no absolute ownership of anything vesting in any individual, with the poor having a rightful share in the wealth of the rich.

ur: مانگنے والے کے لئے اور محروم کے لئے۔

v5.text: For one who asks for help and for one who does not.[4377]

notes.note:
Important Words:

المحروم may signify those persons who from a sense of dignity or from some infirmity would not ask for alms. The word includes animals also in its signification.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: belief in

ur: اور وہ لوگ جو جزا سزا کے دن کی تصدیق کرتے ہیں۔

v5.text: [d]And those who believe in the Day of Judgement to be a reality,[4378]

notes.note:
Commentary:

There can be no real sense of responsibility without a true and living belief in the Hereafter when man shall have to render account of his actions to his Lord and Creator. Belief in the Hereafter is the second cardinal belief of Islam, next to belief in the existence of God.

ar: وَ الَّذِیۡنَ ہُمۡ مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّہِمۡ مُّشۡفِقُوۡنَ ﴿ۚ۲۸﴾
ur: اور وہ لوگ جو اپنے ربّ کے عذاب سے ڈرنے والے ہیں۔

v5.text: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord—

ur: یقیناً اُن کے ربّ کا عذاب ایسا ہے جس سے بچا نہیں جا سکتا۔

v5.text: Verily the punishment of their Lord is not a thing to feel secure from—

ur: اور وہ لوگ جو اپنی شرم گاہوں کی حفاظت کرنے والے ہوتے ہیں۔

v5.text: [a]And those who guard their private parts—

ar: اِلَّا عَلٰۤی  اَزۡوَاجِہِمۡ  اَوۡ مَا مَلَکَتۡ اَیۡمَانُہُمۡ  فَاِنَّہُمۡ  غَیۡرُ  مَلُوۡمِیۡنَ ﴿ۚ۳۱﴾
ur: سوائے اپنی بیویوں کے یا اُن (عورتوں) کے جن کے مالک اُن کے داہنے ہاتھ ہوئے۔ پس یقیناً وہ قابل ملامت نہیں۔

v5.text: [b]Except from their wives and from those whom their right hands possess; such indeed are not to blame;[4379]

notes.note:
Commentary:

For a detailed explanation of this verse see 23:7 and 24:34.

ar: فَمَنِ  ابۡتَغٰی وَرَآءَ ذٰلِکَ فَاُولٰٓئِکَ ہُمُ الۡعٰدُوۡنَ ﴿ۚ۳۲﴾
ur: پس جس نے اس کے سوا (کچھ) چاہا تو یہی ہیں وہ جو حد سے بڑھنے والے ہیں۔

v5.text: [c]But those who seek to go beyond that, it is these who are transgressors—

ar: وَ الَّذِیۡنَ ہُمۡ  لِاَمٰنٰتِہِمۡ وَ عَہۡدِہِمۡ رٰعُوۡنَ ﴿۪ۙ۳۳﴾
ur: اور وہ لوگ جو اپنی امانتوں اور اپنے عہدوں کا پاس رکھنے والے ہیں۔

v5.text: [d]And those who are watchful of their trusts, and their covenants.

ur: اور وہ لوگ جو اپنی شہادتوں پر قائم رہنے والے ہیں۔

v5.text: And those who are upright in their testimonies,

ar: وَ الَّذِیۡنَ ہُمۡ عَلٰی صَلَاتِہِمۡ یُحَافِظُوۡنَ ﴿ؕ۳۵﴾
ur: اور وہ لوگ جو اپنی نمازوں پر محافظ رہتے ہیں۔

v5.text: And those who are strict in the observance of their Prayer.

ur: یہی ہیں وہ جو جنتوں میں اِکرام کا سلوک کئے جائیں گے۔

v5.text: [e]These will be in the Gardens, duly honoured.[4380]

notes.note:
Commentary:

These verses (vv. 24-33) mention those seven special marks of a true believer the possession of which leaves nothing to be desired and renders him fully deserving of the highest reward—the love and pleasure of God—which in the Quran is termed as الفردوس (23:12) or الجنة (the Garden). See also 23:12.

topics.topic: Prophecies in the Holy Qur’an: about: Islam

ur: پس اُن لوگوں کو کیا ہوا تھا جنہوں نے کفر کیا کہ وہ تیری طرف تیزی سے دوڑے چلے آتے تھے۔

v5.text: But what is the matter with those who disbelieve, that they come hastening towards thee,[a]

topics.topic: Prophecies in the Holy Qur’an: about: Islam

ar: عَنِ الۡیَمِیۡنِ وَ عَنِ الشِّمَالِ عِزِیۡنَ ﴿۳۸﴾
ur: دائیں طرف سے بھی اور بائیں طرف سے بھی، ٹولیوں میں بٹے ہوئے۔

v5.text: From the right hand and from the left, in different parties?[4381]

notes.note:
Commentary:

This and the preceding verse give a prophetic description of the coming triumph of Islam when the pagan tribes of Arabia, from every part of the country, hastened to wait in deputations upon the Holy Prophet, begging to be taken into the fold of Islam. Or the verses may refer to the highly alluring offers made by the leaders of the Quraish to the Holy Prophet, if only he should give up preaching against their idols. By some authorities, however, the verses have been taken to refer to the dangerous attacks that were made on the Holy Prophet in different forms by his opponents.

ar: اَیَطۡمَعُ کُلُّ  امۡرِیًٴ  مِّنۡہُمۡ  اَنۡ یُّدۡخَلَ جَنَّۃَ  نَعِیۡمٍ ﴿ۙ۳۹﴾
ur: کیا ان میں سے ہر شخص یہ امید لگائے ہوئے ہے کہ وہ نعمتوں والی جنت میں داخل کیا جائے گا؟

v5.text: Does every man among them hope to enter the Garden of Bliss?

ur: ہرگز نہیں! یقیناً ہم نے ان کو اُس چیز سے پیدا کیا جسے وہ جانتے ہیں۔

v5.text: Never! We have created them of that which they know.[4382]

notes.note:
Commentary:

Taken along with its predecessor, the verse would mean that a man cannot hope to be received into God’s favour by mere expression of a pious wish. He has first to discharge his obligations to God, and his fellow-beings, and by making full use of God-given powers and faculties he has to traverse all the different stages of spiritual progress before he can hope to enter "the Garden of Bliss." The word مما signifies natural powers and faculties with which God has endowed him.

topics.topic: Attributes of Allah: Rabbul-Mashariq (Lord of all Light)
Qadir: powerful: Allah has the power to do all

ar: فَلَاۤ  اُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ الۡمَشٰرِقِ وَ الۡمَغٰرِبِ اِنَّا  لَقٰدِرُوۡنَ ﴿ۙ۴۱﴾
ur: پس خبردار! میں مشارق اور مغارب کے ربّ کی قسم کھاتا ہوں یقیناً ہم ضرور قادر ہیں۔

v5.text: But nay! I swear by the Lord of the Easts and of the Wests, that We have the power[4382A]

notes.note:
Commentary:

See 37:6.

ar: عَلٰۤی  اَنۡ  نُّبَدِّلَ خَیۡرًا مِّنۡہُمۡ ۙ وَ مَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوۡقِیۡنَ ﴿۴۲﴾
ur: اس پر کہ اُنہیں تبدیل کرکے ہم اُن سے بہتر لے آئیں۔ اور ہم پر سبقت نہیں لے جائی جاسکتی۔

v5.text: To bring in their place others better than they, and We cannot be frustrated in Our plans.[4382B]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The opponents of the Holy Prophet are told here that it is an unalterable Divine decree that Islam shall succeed and prevail in Arabia and that if they rejected it, other people would enter its fold and inherit God’s blessings. The old order would change and from its ruins would emerge a new and better order.

ar: فَذَرۡہُمۡ  یَخُوۡضُوۡا وَ یَلۡعَبُوۡا حَتّٰی یُلٰقُوۡا یَوۡمَہُمُ  الَّذِیۡ یُوۡعَدُوۡنَ ﴿ۙ۴۳﴾
ur: پس اُنہیں چھوڑ دے، وہ فضول باتوں میں غرق رہیں اور کھیلیں کھیلتے رہیں یہاں تک کہ وہ اپنے اُس دن کو دیکھ لیں جس کا اُنہیں وعدہ دیا جاتا ہے۔

v5.text: [a]So leave them alone to indulge in idle talk and play until they meet that day of theirs which they are promised,[4383]

notes.note:
Commentary:

The expression, "that day of theirs which they are promised," means the day of the final triumph of Islam in Arabia and the complete defeat and discomfiture of disbelief—the day of the Fall of Mecca.

topics.topic: Day of Requital: Resurrection, Yaumul-Qiyamah, Yaumud-Din, Yaumul-Akhirah, Yaumul-Ba‘th: on that day

ar: یَوۡمَ یَخۡرُجُوۡنَ  مِنَ الۡاَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعًا کَاَنَّہُمۡ  اِلٰی نُصُبٍ یُّوۡفِضُوۡنَ ﴿ۙ۴۴﴾
ur: جس دن وہ قبروں سے تیزی کرتے ہوئے نکلیں گے گویا وہ قربان گاہوں کی طرف دوڑے جا رہے ہوں۔

v5.text: [b]The day when they will come forth from their graves hastening, as though they were racing to a target,[4384]

notes.note:
Important Words:

اجداث (graves) being the plural of جدث which means, a grave; a sepulchre (Lane), it stands here for the houses of the disbelievers who were spiritually no better than dead.

نصب means, a thing set up; a mile-stone; a goal or target (Aqrab).

Commentary:

See next verse.
